item.title: Year of Done
item.description: Done. It’s a word that conjures up finality. Following in the footsteps of 2017’s “Year of Less” I have christened 2018 my “Year of Done”. I’m not a big fan of resolutions, be they New Year’s or otherwise. I do however like the idea of a theme for the year. After some soul-searching, add some cognitive down-time in the month of December, I have decided that “done” will be my theme for 2018.

item.title: Book Report Little Brother
item.description: Set in mid-2000s San Francisco, [Cory Doctorow][craphound]’s Little Brother brings a tale of what can go wrong when yuo have a society that values compliance over independence. A story of technology innovation, [hacker culture][wiki-hackerculture], information sharing and data freedom all set against the backdrop of a modern-day terrorism nightmare. Cory Doctorow highlights a number of different things in our everyday world that allow other people to learn more about you, to track you and build a profile about you.

item.title: Book Report Hamlet's Blackberry
item.description: Title: Hamlet’s Blackberry Author: William Powers I’ve been trying to get this book read for about the last 18 months. It had come highly recommended by a friend who found the book to be a good look into the technological overload of our modern times, and the inherent constant connectivity to the crowds provided by the Internet. It took me quite a while to get into this book. Powers' continual assertion that the technology that we have come to rely on is disconnecting us from ourselves, and our reality.
